entries.meaning: The side of the ditch next to the parapet in a fortification; the scarp.

verbs.description: escarp (third-person singular simple present escarps, present participle escarping, simple past and past participle escarped)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make into, or furnish with, a steep slope, like that of a scarp.
examples: Our men, though quite expos'd, and though the Glacis was all escarp'd upon the live Rock, went on with an undaunted Courage
